pages.text: Nerepisacanthus is an acanthodian from the Silurian period. Most Silurian acanthodian fossils are known from isolated spines, scales or jaws, however, Nerepisacanthus is known from a well-preserved complete specimen. Known from two formations from Canada, it probably lived in freshwater to brackish water.
